page.title: 01Saline in Fife
page.content: Saline is a village with a population of around 2000 situated in the south west of Fife. It lies at an altitude of 450 feet above mean sea level. It's skyline is dominated by Saline Hill at a height of 1100 feet. Saline has the name of being the "Paradise of Fife" and previous inhabitants have claimed it to have the cleanest air in Scotland. Saline is a popular commuter village with it's proximity to four major cities,Perth,Stirling,Edinburgh and Glasgow. It supports two churches,one Church of Scotland and one Roman Catholic Church. It has it's own Primary School, with secondary pupils transported the 6 miles to Dunfermline high schools. The surrounding area is predominantly grassland.
